titles.title: Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Mälkǝʾa sänbätä krǝstiyan "Image of the Sabbath of Christians" / Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus"

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 1ra-29vb, 34ra-39rb) I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 1ara-6ra) I-2) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 6ra-9ra) I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki... "I worship Thee..." (fol. 9ra-vb) I-4a) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 31 miracles (fols. 11ra-29vb), incomplete II) Mälkǝʾa sänbätä krǝstiyan “Image of the Sabbath of Christians” (fols. 32ra-33ra) I-4b) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 5 miracles (fols. 34ra-39rb) III) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus" (fols. 39rb-42ra) III-1) ʾƎsäggǝd lä-mäläkotǝkä ... "I worship Thy Godhead ..." (fols. 39rb-41rb) III-2) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus": 1 miracle (fols. 41va-42ra)

donors.donor: The following persons are mentioned in the supplication formulas: - quire I (hand a): Täsfa Maryam (fols. 6rb, 7vb), Rǝgbä Śǝllase (fol. 6rb), Zä-Wäldä Maryam (fol. 7vb) - quire IV (hand c): ʾabunä Täsfa Maryam (the same as above?, e.g., fols. 34ra, 38ra, 39rb), Wäldä Ḥawaryat (e.g., fols. 34ra, 36ra, 41va).

dcomments.dcomment: Quires II-III: second half of the 17th cent. (?) Quire I: second half of the 19th cent. (?) Quire IV: second half of the 19th cent. (?)

txstates.txstate: The Ms. consists of three parts (quires I, II-III and IV), crudely hold together with recent threads, without any binding. Many fols. are worn, affected by humidity, on some fols. the text is abraded. Fol. 33 is of smaller size.

txfolios.txfolio: (42+1) The first folio, that was not foliated, has been given the number 1 (hence the following images was renumbered with 1a).

squires.squire: <I(11; s.l.: 1, stub after 10/fols. 1r-10v)> – II(10/fols. 11r-20v) – III(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 21r-29v) – <IV(13; s.l.: 4, stub after 10/fols. 30r-42v)>

taunit.mr-info: Quire I: all data for fol. 3r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Quires II-III: all data for fol. 13r.
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Some leaves have an additional bottom ruled line not used by the scribe (fols. 12rv, 22r-24r, 27r-29v).

taunit.mr-info: Quire IV: all data for fol. 32r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/B. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Hand a: second half of the 19th century (?). Hand b: second half of the 17th cent. (?). Hand c: second half of the 19th century

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: poor and irregular. Hand b: fine and careful. Hand c: mediocre.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3 (quire I): angular. Hand b: Texts I-4a (quires II, III): finely shaped, slender, slightly left-sloping letters. Hand c: Texts I-4b, II, III (quire IV): broadly shaped letters; it appears more irregular towards the end of the unit (fols. 39v-42ra) where it shows some similarities with hand a.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of other characters like Yoḥannǝs (fol. 5vb); names of donors (hands a and c); the words sälam "salutation" and sänbät ("Sabbath") in Text II; subsection numbers in Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Several groups of lines in the incipit of Text I-1 (alternating with black lines), a few words in the incipit of Text I-2 and of subsections in Texts I-1, I-2; two initial lines in the incipit of Text I-3; a few lines on the incipit page of Text I-4a (alternating with black lines); two or three initial lines in the incipit of subsections of Text I-4 (miracles); two initial lines in the incipit of Texts II, III and IV.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
Text I-2 includes the hymns: - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bä-kǝlʾe Maryam wäladitä ʾamlak... "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, Godbearing ..." (fol. 7va l.4-l.23) - ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bä-kǝlʾe Maryam ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fol. 7vb l.23-8ra l.22) (cp. ChRep no. 373) - Sälam läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bä-kǝlʾe Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan ... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fols. 8ra l.22-9ra).
Some miracles of Mary (Text I-4a) are numbered.

additional.cont: Fols. 30va-31rb: Excerpt from Säˁatat zä-lelit "Horologium for the Night" (MSLN p. 116).

extras.extra: - The title ተአምረ፡ ማርያም is written on fol. 1r, in pen. - Erased note on fol. 34r (upper margin). - Immediate correction: letters or words to be cancelled are indicated by thin lines above and below the word on fol. 32rb. - Omitted letters or words written interlineally: e.g., fols. 32rb, 32va, 34rb, 35ra, 41rb. - Pen trial on fol. 33ra.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts written in the middle of the upper margin (hand c): ዕረፍታ: fol. 34r ዕረፍታ: fol. 34vb ዕረፍታ: fol. 36ra ጽዮን: fol. 37ra ጽዮን: fol. 38ra. Some indications are not legible due to parchment damage (fol. 39rb) or faded ink (fol. 41ra, rb).

frames.frame: Fol. 1ra, rb (incipit page Text I-1): simple ornamental bands; geometric motifs.
